articles.headline: Zelensky Removes His Top General, in Major Shake-Up of Ukraine Military
articles.snippet: Gen. Valery Zaluzhny led the effort that thwarted Russia’s initial assault on Kyiv. But his troops have struggled to make progress recently, and tensions have mounted with the civilian leadership.
articles.abstract: Gen. Valery Zaluzhny led the effort that thwarted Russia’s initial assault on Kyiv. But his troops have struggled to make progress recently, and tensions have mounted with the civilian leadership.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine on Thursday removed his top general as part of a sweeping overhaul of his military command, the most significant shake-up in Ukrainian leadership since Russia invaded almost two years ago.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer and Marc Santora

articles.headline: Her Son Vanished After a 1980 Run-In With Police. She Wants Answers.
articles.snippet: Investigators in Kentucky have pursued many leads in the search for Randy Sellers, except for what some critics say is the most obvious one.
articles.abstract: Investigators in Kentucky have pursued many leads in the search for Randy Sellers, except for what some critics say is the most obvious one.
articles.lead_paragraph: At first, Wanda Cotton searched the water.
articles.byline: By Shaila Dewan and Madeleine Hordinski

articles.headline: ‘Zombie Offices’ Spell Trouble for Some Banks
articles.snippet: Bank tremors serve as a reminder: Just because a crisis hasn’t hit immediately doesn’t mean commercial real estate pain isn’t coming.
articles.abstract: Bank tremors serve as a reminder: Just because a crisis hasn’t hit immediately doesn’t mean commercial real estate pain isn’t coming.
articles.lead_paragraph: Graceful Art Deco buildings towering above Chicago’s key business district report occupancy rates as low as 17 percent.

articles.headline: Special Counsel’s Report Puts Biden’s Age and Memory in the Spotlight
articles.snippet: After an inquiry concluded that President Biden was “well-meaning” but had “a poor memory,” he angrily fired back in an attempt at political damage control.
articles.abstract: After an inquiry concluded that President Biden was “well-meaning” but had “a poor memory,” he angrily fired back in an attempt at political damage control.
articles.lead_paragraph: The decision on Thursday not to file criminal charges against President Biden for mishandling classified documents should have been an unequivocal legal exoneration.

articles.headline: Putin Calls on U.S. to ‘Negotiate’ on Ukraine in Tucker Carlson Interview
articles.snippet: In a two-hour interview, President Vladimir Putin of Russia was more direct than usual about how he sees his Ukraine invasion ending: not with a military victory, but a deal with the West.
articles.abstract: In a two-hour interview, President Vladimir Putin of Russia was more direct than usual about how he sees his Ukraine invasion ending: not with a military victory, but a deal with the West.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia has worked for decades to win allies in the West, using his spy agencies to interfere in elections and deploying diplomats to build links with Kremlin-friendly politicians.

articles.headline: Tucker Carlson Regains the Bullhorn, at Least Temporarily
articles.snippet: Mr. Carlson’s interview with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia put him back on center stage for the first time since his Fox News show was canceled.
articles.abstract: Mr. Carlson’s interview with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia put him back on center stage for the first time since his Fox News show was canceled.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last spring, it seemed Tucker Carlson might have reached the end of his fiery path through American media and politics.
articles.byline: By Jim Rutenberg and Michael M. Grynbaum

articles.headline: Super Bowl Broadcast Is a Crossroads for CBS Sports
articles.snippet: The storied network is facing a wave of change, including new leadership, the possible sale of its parent company and the continued challenge of streaming.
articles.abstract: The storied network is facing a wave of change, including new leadership, the possible sale of its parent company and the continued challenge of streaming.
articles.lead_paragraph: On the one hand, Sunday will be a joyous occasion for CBS Sports. The sports division will broadcast its 22nd Super Bowl, the most of any network. The game is guaranteed to be the most-watched event in television this year, and it will generate hundreds of millions in advertising revenue and provide a huge promotional platform for CBS and its parent company, Paramount.
articles.byline: By John Koblin and Kevin Draper
